element.name: spl-ctrl_encrypted_credentials
element.label: Encrypting Credentials
element.key:
If you require an encrypted credential in your configuration , then you can enter it on the App's setup page

Then in your configration below refer to it in the format {encrypted:somekey}

Where somekey is any value you choose to enter on the setup page to reference your credential.

element.name: activation_key
element.label: Activation Key
element.key: Visit http://www.baboonbones.com/#activation to obtain a non-expiring key

element.name: log_level
element.label: Log Level
element.key: Modular Input script Python logging level for messages written to $SPLUNK_HOME/var/log/splunk/snmpmodinput_app_modularinput.log , defaults to 'INFO'

element.name: snmp_mode
element.label: SNMP Mode
element.key: The SNMP mode to run this stanza in

element.name: use_system_python
element.label: Use System Python ?
element.key: Whether or not to use a System Python runtime vs Splunk's built in Python runtime. Defaults to false. You only really need to use a System Python for SNMP v3 applications where you've installed the pycryptodomex package dependency

element.name: system_python_path
element.label: System Python Path
element.key: Defaults to /usr/bin/python

element.name: run_process_checker
element.label: Run Process Checker ?
element.key: Whether or not to autonomously manage the script's running state. This is used in case Splunk doesn't properly stop running snmp.py processes.Defaults to true.

element.name: ipv6
element.label: IP Version 6
element.key: Whether or not this is an IP version 6 address. Defaults to false.

element.name: snmp_version
element.label: SNMP Version
element.key: The SNMP Version , 1 / 2C / 3 . Defaults to 2C

element.name: communitystring
element.label: Community String
element.key: Community String used for SNMP version 1 and 2C authentication.Defaults to "public"

element.name: v3_securityName
element.label: SNMPv3 USM username
element.key: SNMPv3 USM username

element.name: v3_securityEngineId
element.label: SNMPv3 Engine ID
element.key: HEX value of the Engine ID ie: 8000000001020304

element.name: v3_authKey
element.label: SNMPv3 Authorization Key
element.key: SNMPv3 secret authorization key used within USM for SNMP PDU authorization. Setting it to a non-empty value implies MD5-based PDU authentication (defaults to usmHMACMD5AuthProtocol) to take effect. Default hashing method may be changed by means of further Authorization Protocol parameter

element.name: v3_privKey
element.label: SNMPv3 Encryption Key
element.key: SNMPv3 secret encryption key used within USM for SNMP PDU encryption. Setting it to a non-empty value implies MD5-based PDU authentication (defaults to usmHMACMD5AuthProtocol) and DES-based encryption (defaults to usmDESPrivProtocol) to take effect. Default hashing and/or encryption methods may be changed by means of further Authorization Protocol and/or Encryption Protocol parameters.

element.name: v3_authProtocol
element.label: SNMPv3 Authorization Protocol
element.key: May be used to specify non-default hash function algorithm.

element.name: v3_privProtocol
element.label: SNMPv3 Encryption Key Protocol
element.key: May be used to specify non-default ciphering algorithm.

element.name: mibs
element.key: Custom MIBs

element.name: mib_names
element.label: MIB Names
element.key:
Comma delimited list of MIB names to be applied ie: IF-MIB,DNS-SERVER-MIB,BRIDGE-MIB.

Many industry standard MIBs ship with the Modular Input.
You can see which MIBs are available by default by looking in SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/snmp_ta/bin/mibs/pysnmp_mibs

Any custom MIB text files can be dumped in the SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/snmp_ta/bin/mibs/user_plaintext_mibs directory and they will be automatically compiled to Python modules at runtime.

element.name: handler
element.key: Custom Response Handling

element.name: response_handler
element.label: Response Handler
element.key: Python classname of custom response handler in SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/snmp_ta/bin/responsehandlers.py , defaults to DefaultResponseHandler

element.name: response_handler_args
element.label: Response Handler Arguments
element.key: Response Handler arguments string , key=value,key2=value2

element.name: attributes
element.key: SNMP Attribute polling settings

element.name: destination
element.label: Destination
element.key: IP or hostname of the device you would like to query, or a comma delimited list

element.name: port
element.label: Port
element.key: The SNMP port. Defaults to 161

element.name: object_names
element.label: Object Names List
element.key:
1 or more Objects Names , comma delimited , in either textual(iso.org.dod.internet.mgmt.mib-2.system.sysDescr.0) or numerical(1.3.6.1.2.1.1.3.0) format.

By default a GET operation will be executed.

If you require bulk operations such as traversing a subtree , then select 1 of the SNMP Walking options below.

element.name: do_bulk_get
element.label: Perform a SNMPWALK using GETBULK
element.key: GETBULK is generally more efficient (less requests) , but can also return more data in the response PDU

element.name: do_get_subtree
element.label: Perform a SNMPWALK using GETNEXT
element.key: GETNEXT fires off more requests , but will return less data in the response PDU

element.name: non_repeaters
element.label: Non Repeaters (for GETBULK operations)
element.key: The number of objects that are only expected to return a single GETNEXT instance, not multiple instances. Defaults to 0.

element.name: max_repetitions
element.label: Max Repetitions (for GETBULK operations)
element.key: The number of objects that should be returned for all the repeating OIDs.Defaults to 25.

element.name: lexicographic_mode
element.label: Lexicographic Mode (for all SNMP Walking operations)
element.key: Walk SNMP agentâ€™s MIB till the end (if checked), otherwise (if not checked) stop iteration when all response MIB variables leave the scope of initial MIB variables in the OID list. Default is false.

element.name: split_bulk_output
element.label: Split Bulk Results
element.key: Whether or not to split up bulk output into individual events. Defaults to false.

element.name: snmpinterval
element.label: Interval
element.key: How often to run the SNMP query (in seconds). Defaults to 60 seconds

element.name: retries
element.label: Automatic Retries
element.key: Number of times to automatically retry polling before giving up. Defaults to 5

element.name: timeout
element.label: Timeout
element.key: SNMP attribute polling timeout (in seconds). Defaults to 1 second. NOTE: timer resolution is about 0.5 seconds

element.name: traps
element.key: SNMP Trap listener settings

element.name: trap_host
element.label: TRAP listener host
element.key: TRAP listener host. Defaults to localhost.IMPORTANT : Ensure that you set this to the Hostname or IP that the trap client is sending to.

element.name: trap_port
element.label: TRAP listener port
element.key: TRAP listener port. Defaults to 162. Ensure that you have the necessary OS user permissions for port values 0-1024

element.name: trap_rdns
element.label: Reverse DNS lookup of trap sources.
element.key: TRAP Generating Host reverse DNS lookup. Forces host field to the DNS lookup if available insted of IP address. Defaults to false. Be aware may cause large DNS lookup volume
